fact_list.fact_text: Vehicle breakdown and warning signs in driving include slippery road and gated level crossing.
Warning signs are to be placed at least 20 metres from the rear of the vehicle.
Uneven road and road hump ahead are examples of warning signs.
Steep upward slope and steep downward slope are categorized as warning signs in driving.
Vehicles approaching roads leading to quays, river banks, or seas are warned of road ending ahead.
BASIC THEORY OF DRIVING is a topic listed under PART B SIGNS & SIGNALS.
